00056   // special effect flags
00057   enum MMDB_READ_FLAG  {
00058     MMDBF_AutoSerials            = 0x00000001,
00059     MMDBF_NoCoordRead            = 0x00000002,
00060     MMDBF_SimRWBROOK             = 0x00000004,
00061     MMDBF_PrintCIFWarnings       = 0x00000008,
00062     MMDBF_EnforceSpaces          = 0x00000010,
00063     MMDBF_IgnoreDuplSeqNum       = 0x00000020,
00064     MMDBF_IgnoreSegID            = 0x00000040,
00065     MMDBF_IgnoreElement          = 0x00000080,
00066     MMDBF_IgnoreCharge           = 0x00000100,
00067     MMDBF_IgnoreNonCoorPDBErrors = 0x00000200,
00068     MMDBF_IgnoreUnmatch          = 0x00000400,
00069     MMDBF_IgnoreBlankLines       = 0x00000800,
00070     MMDBF_IgnoreHash             = 0x00001000,
00071     MMDBF_IgnoreRemarks          = 0x00002000,
00072     MMDBF_AllowDuplChainID       = 0x00004000,
00073     MMDBF_FixSpaceGroup          = 0x00008000,
00074     MMDBF_EnforceAtomNames       = 0x00010000,
00075     MMDBF_EnforceUniqueChainID   = 0x00020000,
00076     MMDBF_DoNotProcessSpaceGroup = 0x00040000
00077   };
00078 
00079   // MMDBF_EnforceUniqueChainID   will make MMDB to rename chains on
00080   //         reading a file such as to maintain chains uniquesness. This
00081   //         is supposed to work only with 1-letter chain IDs and only
00082   //         if chain names are interchanged in the file. For example,
00083   //         if file contains a sequence of chains named
00084   //
00085   //              A,B, A,B, A,B, A,B, A,B
00086   //
00087   //         and this flag is set on, the resulting chain names in
00088   //         MMDB will be:
00089   //
00090   //              A,B, A0,B0, A1,B1, A2,B2, A3,B3
00091   //
00092 
00093   // file types:
00094   enum MMDB_FILE_TYPE  {
00095     MMDB_FILE_Undefined = -1,
00096     MMDB_FILE_PDB       =  0,
00097     MMDB_FILE_CIF       =  1,
00098     MMDB_FILE_Binary    =  2
00099   };
00100 
00101   // cleanup flags:
00102   enum PDB_CLEAN_FLAG  {
00103     PDBCLEAN_ATNAME         = 0x00000001,
00104     PDBCLEAN_TER            = 0x00000002,
00105     PDBCLEAN_CHAIN          = 0x00000004,
00106     PDBCLEAN_CHAIN_STRONG   = 0x00000008,
00107     PDBCLEAN_ALTCODE        = 0x00000010,
00108     PDBCLEAN_ALTCODE_STRONG = 0x00000020,
00109     PDBCLEAN_SERIAL         = 0x00000040,
00110     PDBCLEAN_SEQNUM         = 0x00000080,
00111     PDBCLEAN_CHAIN_ORDER    = 0x00000100,
00112     PDBCLEAN_CHAIN_ORDER_IX = 0x00000200,
00113     PDBCLEAN_SOLVENT        = 0x00000400,
00114     PDBCLEAN_INDEX          = 0x00000800,
00115     PDBCLEAN_ELEMENT        = 0x00001000,
00116     PDBCLEAN_ELEMENT_STRONG = 0x00002000
00117   };

00119   // crystallographic info inquery

00127     CRRDY_Ambiguous        = -3,
00128     CRRDY_NoCell           = -4,
00129     CRRDY_NoSpaceGroup     = -5

00205       //  PutPDBString adds a PDB-keyworded string
00206       // to the existing structure. Note that the string
00207       // is namely added meaning that it will be the
00208       // last REMARK, last JRNL, last ATOM etc. string
00209       // -- always the last one in its group.
00210       ERROR_CODE PutPDBString ( cpstr PDBString );
00211 
00212 
00213       //  PDBCleanup(..) cleans coordinate part to comply with PDB
00214       // standards and MMDB "expectations":
00215       //
00216       //  PDBCLEAN_ATNAME  pads atom names with spaces to form
00217       //                   4-symbol names
00218       //  PDBCLEAN_TER     inserts TER cards in the end of each chain
00219       //  PDBCLEAN_CHAIN   generates 1-character chain ids instead of
00220       //                   those many-character
00221       //  PDBCLEAN_CHAIN_STRONG generates 1-character chain ids starting
00222       //                   from 'A' on for all ids, including the
00223       //                   single-character ones
00224       //  PDBCLEAN_ALTCODE generates 1-character alternative codes
00225       //                   instead of many-character ones
00226       //  PDBCLEAN_ALTCODE_STRONG generates 1-character alternative codes
00227       //                   from 'A' on for all codes, including the
00228       //                   single-character ones
00229       //  PDBCLEAN_SERIAL  puts serial numbers in due order
00230       //  PDBCLEAN_SEQNUM  renumbers all residues so that they go
00231       //                   incrementally-by-one without insertion codes
00232       //  PDBCLEAN_CHAIN_ORDER puts chains in order of atom's serial
00233       //                   numbers
00234       //  PDBCLEAN_CHAIN_ORDER_IX puts chains in order of atom's
00235       //                   indices internal to MMDB
00236       //  PDBCLEAN_SOLVENT moves solvent chains at the end of each model
00237       //
00238       //  Return codes (as bits):
00239       //  0                Ok
00240       //  PDBCLEAN_CHAIN   too many chains for assigning them
00241       //                   1-letter codes
00242       //  PDBCLEAN_ATNAME  element names were not available
00243       //  PDBCLEAN_ALTCODE too many alternative codes encountered.
00244       //
00245       word  PDBCleanup ( word CleanKey );
00246 
00247       //     Makes all atoms in chain 'chainID', in all models, as
00248       //  'Het' atoms if Make is set True, and makes them 'ordinary'
00249       //  atoms otherwise. 'Ter' is automatically removed when
00250       //  converting to 'Het' atoms, and is automatically added
00251       //  when converting to 'ordinary' atoms. This may cause
00252       //  disorder in serial numbers -- just call
00253       //  PDBClean(PDBCLEAN_SERIAL) when necessary to fix this.
00254       void  MakeHetAtoms ( cpstr chainID, bool Make );
00255 
00256       //  ---------------  Working with atoms by serial numbers  ---
00257 
00258       inline PPAtom GetAtomArray   ()  { return atom;   }
00259       inline int GetAtomArrayLength()  { return atmLen; } // strictly not for
00260                                                // use in applications!!
00261       PAtom  GetAtomI ( int index );   // returns Atom[index-1]
00262 
00263       //   PutAtom(..) puts atom with the specified properties
00264       // into the structure. The current model is used; if no model
00265       // is set (crModel==NULL), one is created. Coordinates and
00266       // other parameters of the atom need to be set separately.
00267       //   The place, at which the atom is put, is determined by
00268       // index. If index is positive, then it points onto (index-1)th
00269       // element of the Atom array (the index counts 1,2,... and
00270       // generally coincides with the atom's serial number). If
00271       // there is already an atom at this position in the system,
00272       // the new atom will REPLACE it. The corresponding residues
00273       // are automatically updated.
00274       //   If index is null (=0), the new atom will be put on
00275       // the top of the structure, i.e. it will be put into
00276       // (index=nAtoms+1)-th position.
00277       //   If index is negative, then the new atom is INSERTED
00278       // BEFORE the atom in the (-index)th position. For saving
00279       // the computational efforts, this WILL NOT cause the
00280       // recalculation of all atoms' serial numbers according
00281       // to their actual positions. It will be needed, however,
00282       // for putting the things in order at a certain point,
00283       // especially before writing an output ASCII file. NOTE
00284       // that this ordering is never done automatically.
00285       //   In a correct PDB file the serial number (serNum) is always
00286       // equal to its position (index). However here we allow them
00287       // to be different for easing the management of relations,
00288       // particularly the connectivity.
00289       //
00290       //   Limitation: if PutAtom implies creating new
00291       // chains/residues, these are always created on the top
00292       // of existing chains/residues.
00293       int   PutAtom ( int            index,
00294                       int            serNum,
00295                       const AtomName atomName,
00296                       const ResName  resName,
00297                       const ChainID  chainID,
00298                       int            seqNum,
00299                       const InsCode  insCode,
00300                       const AltLoc   altLoc,
00301                       const SegID    segID,
00302                       const Element  element );
00303 
00304       int   PutAtom (
00305                  int    index,    // same meaning as above
00306                  PAtom   A,       // pointer to completed atom class
00307                  int    serNum=0  // 0 means that the serial number
00308                                   // will be set equal to index.
00309                                   // Otherwise the serial number
00310                                   // is set to the specified
00311                                   // value
00312                     );
00313 
00314 
00315       //    RemoveAtom(..) removes atom at the specified index
00316       // in the Atom array. This index is always accessible
00317       // as Atom[index]->index. If this leaves a residue empty,
00318       // the residue is removed. If this leaves an empty chain,
00319       // the chain is removed as well; the same happens to the
00320       // model.
00321       void  RemoveAtom ( int index );
00322 
00323       int   FinishStructEdit();
00324 
00325       void  TrimModelTable();
00326 
00327       //  ----------------  Deleting models  -----------------------
00328 
00329       int  DeleteAllModels  ();
00330       bool GetNewChainID ( int modelNo, ChainID chID, int length=1 );

00334       int   CrystReady();
00335       //    Returns flags:
00336       // CRRDY_Complete       if crystallographic information is complete
00337       // CRRDY_NotPrecise     if cryst. inf-n is not precise
00338       // CRRDY_isTranslation  if cryst. inf-n contains translation
00339       // CRRDY_NoOrthCode      no orthogonalization code
00340       //    Fatal:
00341       // CRRDY_NoTransfMatrices  if transform. matrices were not
00342       //                         calculated
00343       // CRRDY_Unchecked         if cryst. inf-n was not checked
00344       // CRRDY_Ambiguous         if cryst. inf-n is ambiguous
00345       // CRRDY_NoCell            if cryst. inf-n is unusable
00346       // CRRDY_NoSpaceGroup      if space group is not set
00347

00422       void GetROMatrix ( mat44 & RO );
00423 
00424       //  GetTMatrix(..) calculates and returns the coordinate
00425       //  transformation matrix, which converts orthogonal coordinates
00426       //  according to the symmetry operation number Nop and places
00427       //  them into unit cell shifted by cellshift_a a's, cellshift_b
00428       //  b's and cellshift_c c's.
00429       //
00430       //  Return 0 means everything's fine,
00431       //         1 there's no symmetry operation Nop defined
00432       //         2 fractionalizing/orthogonalizing matrices were not
00433       //           calculated
00434       //         3 cell parameters were not set up.
00435       int GetTMatrix ( mat44 & TMatrix, int Nop,
00436                        int cellshift_a, int cellshift_b,
00437                        int cellshift_c );
00438 
00439       //  GetUCTMatrix(..) calculates and returns the coordinate
00440       //  transformation matrix, which converts orthogonal coordinates
00441       //  according to the symmetry operation number Nop. Translation
00442       //  part of the matrix is being chosen such that point (x,y,z)
00443       //  has least distance to the center of primary (333) unit cell,
00444       //  and then it is shifted by cellshift_a a's, cellshift_b b's and
00445       //  cellshift_c c's.
00446       //
00447       //  Return 0 means everything's fine,
00448       //         1 there's no symmetry operation Nop defined
00449       //         2 fractionalizing/orthogonalizing matrices were not
00450       //           calculated
00451       //         3 cell parameters were not set up.
00452       int GetUCTMatrix ( mat44 & TMatrix, int Nop,
00453                          realtype x, realtype y, realtype z,
00454                          int cellshift_a, int cellshift_b,
00455                          int cellshift_c );
00456 
00457       //  GetFractMatrix(..) calculates and returns the coordinate
00458       //  transformation matrix, which converts fractional coordinates
00459       //  according to the symmetry operation number Nop and places them
00460       //  into unit cell shifted by cellshift_a a's, cellshift_b b's
00461       //  and cellshift_c c's.
00462       //
00463       //  Return 0 means everything's fine,
00464       //         1 there's no symmetry operation Nop defined
00465       //         2 fractionalizing/orthogonalizing matrices were not
00466       //           calculated
00467       //         3 cell parameters were not set up.
00468       int GetFractMatrix ( mat44 & TMatrix, int Nop,
00469                            int cellshift_a, int cellshift_b,
00470                            int cellshift_c );
00471 
00472 
00473       //  GetSymOpMatrix(..) returns the transformation matrix for
00474       //  Nop-th symmetry operator in the space group
00475       //
00476       //  Return 0 means everything's fine,
00477       //         1 there's no symmetry operation Nop defined
00478       //         2 fractionalizing/orthogonalizing matrices were not
00479       //           calculated
00480       //         3 cell parameters were not set up.
00481       //
00482       int GetSymOpMatrix ( mat44 & TMatrix, int Nop );
00483

00513       // GetStructureTitle() returns the contents of TITLE record
00514       // unfolded into single line. If Title is missing, returns
00515       // contents of COMPND(:MOLECULE). If COMPND is missing, returns
00516       // HEADER. If Header is missing, returns PDB code. If no PDB
00517       // code is there, returns "Not available".
00518       pstr  GetStructureTitle ( pstr & L );

00526     protected :

00528       word       Flags;    // special effect flags
00529       int        FType;    // type of last file operation:
00530                            //    -1 : none
00531                            //     0 : PDB
00532                            //     1 : CIF
00533                            //     2 : BIN
00534                            // encoded as MMDB_FILE_XXXXX above
00535

00539

00542 
00543       int        nAtoms;   // number of atoms
00544       int        atmLen;   // length of Atom array
00545       PPAtom     atom;     // array of atoms ordered by serial numbers
00546 
00547       AtomPath   DefPath;  // default coordinate path
00548 
00549       ClassContainer SA;   // string container for unrecognized strings
00550                            // which are between the title and the
00551                            // crystallographic sections
00552       ClassContainer Footnote;  // string container for footnotes
00553       ClassContainer SB;   // string container for unrecognized strings
00554                            // which are between the crystallographic and
00555                            // the coordinate sections
00556       ClassContainer SC;   // string container for unrecognized strings
00557                            // following the coordinate section
00558

00617 
00618   //  isMMDBBIN will return
00619   //    -1   if file FName does not exist
00620   //     0   if file FName is likely a MMDB BIN (binary) file
00621   //     1   if file FName is not a MMDB BIN (binary) file
00622   //     2   if file FName is likely a MMDB BIN (binary) file,
00623   //         but of a wrong edition (i.e. produced by a lower
00624   //         version of MMDB).
00625   extern int isMMDBBIN ( cpstr FName, io::GZ_MODE gzipMode=io::GZM_CHECK );
00626   extern int isMMDBBIN ( io::RFile f );
00627 
00628   //  isPDB will return
00629   //    -1   if file FName does not exist
00630   //     0   if file FName is likely a PDB file
00631   //     1   if file FName is not a PDB file
00632   extern int isPDB ( cpstr FName, io::GZ_MODE gzipMode=io::GZM_CHECK,
00633                      bool IgnoreBlankLines=false );
00634   extern int isPDB ( io::RFile f, bool IgnoreBlankLines=false );
